item.title: Randomised Controlled Trials: Anything But Fragile
item.description: Preamble In response to the deluge of studies that reappraise previously conducted studies with the fragility index and the permeation of this method into prominant aspects of the medical community, I wrote this editorial some years ago. Sadly, I could not get the article picked up by a medical journal, and so I am posting it here. I hope this is of use. Introduction In 2014, the fragility index was proposed to evaluate the strength of evidence provided by a randomised controlled trial (RCT) (1).
